paper.title: Beam Commissioning of the Demonstrator Setup for the Superconducting Continuous Wave HIM/GSI-Linac
paper.abstract: During successful beam commissioning of the superconducting 15-gap Crossbar H-mode cavity at GSI Helmholtzzentrum für Schwerionenforschung heavy ions up to the design beam energy have been accelerated. The design acceleration gain of 3.5 MeV inside a length of less than 70 cm has been reached with full transmission for heavy ion beams of up to 1.5 particle mueA. The measured beam parameters confirm sufficient beam quality. The machine beam commissioning is a major milestone of the R&D for the superconducting heavy ion continuous wave linear accelerator HELIAC of Helmholtz Institute Mainz (HIM) and GSI developed in collaboration with IAP Goethe-University Frankfurt. The next step is the procurement and commissioning of so called 'Advanced Demonstrator' - the first of series cryo module for the entire accelerator HELIAC. Results of further Demonstrator beam tests, as well as the status of the Advanced demonstrator project will be reported.

abstract_log.log_status: 3) Is some aspect or part of the work original or demonstrate clear progress?
4) Is the presentation of methods, results and conclusion understandable?
5) Is the paper written in good English?
6) Does the paper acknowledge the work of others in the same field?
7) Does the paper include appropriate references to the literature?
2) Does the paper include own work, performed by the authors and not published elsewhere?
1) Is the work free of obvious scientific or technical errors and important factual mistakes?

abstract_log.comments:
The paper is very interesting and evaluates an accelerating system for CW beams, that will be probably heavily used in the next generation of linacs.
The paper is generally clear and the scientific contribution is evident, only minor issues should be addressed before the publication.
From the scientific point of view, the setup presented in the Table 1 is for a beam with mass-to-charge ratio of 6, while the first beam considered during the commissioning is Argon 11+, that has a mass-to-charge ratio of 3.27. In general several beams with different mass-to-ratio are analyzed in the papers and some explanation about the different setup and results as function of the ion mass and charge would be beneficial for the reader.
Another information that is not well developed is the beam quality in terms of acceptance and emittance. The emittance is cited only briefly in the BEAM TESTS OF DEMONSTRATOR section mentioning only a 15% (10%) growth in the horizontal (vertical) plane without any further detail. Considering that the paper is about beam commissioning, the reader may expect to have more details about the measured beam quality in the phase space, the acceptance of the cavity and the comparison with simulations.
From the non scientific point of view, the article shows several issues (I counted around 30 between grammar errors and typos) of english.
abstract_log.editor_notes: If the authors want the PDF with the errors marked, I can provide it.

abstract_log.comments:
The following English issues should be addressed. Otherwise it is valid for approval for me.
Abstract - of series - should read the first series of cryomodules
Beam Tests of Demonstrator - Prior the realization of HELIAC, (insert comma) - straightforward - should read forward - provide for maximum magneti fields - should read provide a maximum magnetic fields - provides for 2 weeks - remove for - IAP - not defined - mile stones - should read milestones - HPR - not defined - RI - not defined - goals has been exceeded - should read goals have been exceeded - Inside ISO4 class clean room, (insert comma) - Fig. 2 provides for beam instrumentation - should read Fig. 2 shows the beam instrumentation - At June 2017 - should read In June 2017 - first time accelerated - should read accelerated for the first time - Fig. 3 show calculated kinetic - should read Fig. 3 shows the calculated kinetic
Advanced Demonstrator - vertical cryostat shows - should read vertical cryostat show - CH2 cavity is short before - should read CH2 cavity is just before - After the qualifying vacuum leak testing - should read After the test to qualify the vacuum leaks - GSI provides for an enlarged - should read GSI provides an enlarged

abstract_log.comments:
This is a nice piece of work. However, some of the grammar should be improved before publication. I hope you can find and correct the following
1. Define the acronym CH. This could be done in the first line of the abstract. 2. "In the low- and medium- energy range cw-Linacs..." should be a comma "In the low- and medium- energy range, cw-Linacs..." 3. "key parameter of the HELIAC..." should be "key parameters of the HELIAC..." 4. "in collaboration of" should be "in collaboration with" 5. "is located in forward direction of..." should be "is located downstream of..." 6. "The transversal beam emittance has been exemplary measured..." should be "Exemplary transverse beam emittances have been measured..." 7. "The total 90 % horizontal beam emit- tance is measured for 0.74 μm, while in the vertical plane the total 90 % emittance is 0.47 μm only. " should be "The measured 90% emittances in the horizontal and vertical planes are only 0.74 μm and 0.47 μm, respectively. "
8. "with bunch shape monitor" should be "with a bunch shape monitor" 9. "impressive small minimum bunch length " should be "impressively small minimum bunch length" 10. "obtained by numerical solution of equation of motion for charged particle..." would be more usual to say "obtained by tracking charged particles..."
11. "Later on the Advanced Demonstrator is foreseen to be used as first of series of four cryomodules of the HELIAC accelerator." should be "In the future, the Advanced Demonstrator is foreseen to be used as the first of a series of four cryomodules of the HELIAC accelerator." 12. "After the final preparation steps by vendor and assembly of the helium jacket both cavities" needs a comma ""After the final preparation steps by the vendor and assembly of the helium jacket, both cavities..." "and assembled to the accelerator string" should be "and added to the accelerator string"
13. "injector or FAIR" should be "injector for FAIR" 14. "coulomb barrier to hold GSI SHE program world wide competitive" should be "Coulomb barrier to ensure the GSI SHE program remains competitive world wide."
15. The following sentence appears at the end of the Introduction and in the Conclusion. I recommend removing it in the Conclusion. "The HELIAC should serve for physics experiments, smoothly varying the output particle energy from 3.5 to 7.3 MeV/u and simultaneously preserving high beam quality."
abstract_log.editor_notes: This is a nice piece of work. However, some of the grammar should be improved before publication. I have made some suggestions to the author.

"located downstream of of" you should remove an "of" "Exemplary the transversal beam emittance have been measured...".. you need to remove "the".

You may also, as you wish, come to the JACOW proceedings office so we can sort it through together.
Best regards, Gustavo Bruno

Please, take a look to see if there are no undesirable changes.
Best regards, Gustavo Bruno

paper.sub_class: A09 Muon Accelerators and Neutrino Factories
paper.title: A Bunch Structure Measurement of Muons Accelerated by RFQ Using a Longitudinal Beam-Profile Monitor With High Time Resolution
paper.abstract: J-PARC E34 experiment intends to measure the anomalous magnetic moment and electric dipole moment of muon precisely by a different way from the previous experiment. In this experiment, a low-emittance muon beam is provided using the muons with the thermal energy and the four-stage linac. The demonstration of the first muon RF acceleration with an RFQ linac was conducted and the transverse profile of the accelerated muons was measured last year. As one of the remaining issues for the beam-diagnostic system, the longitudinal beam profile after the RFQ should be measured to match the profile to the designed acceptance of the subsequent accelerator. For this purpose, the new longitudinal beam monitor using the micro-channel plate is under development. The time resolution aims to be around 30 to 40 ps corresponding to 1 % of a period of an operation frequency of the accelerator, which is 324 MHz. On November 2018, the bunch structure of accelerated muons of 89 keV with the RFQ was measured using this monitor at the J-PARC MLF. The latest analysis result of this measurement will be reported in this poster.
paper.agency: This work is supported by JSPS KAKENHI Grant Numbers JP15H03666,JP15H05742,JP16H03987,JP16J07784,JP18H03707 and JP18H05226.

paper.sub_class: A09 Muon Accelerators and Neutrino Factories
paper.title: Commissioning and First Results of the Fermilab Muon Campus
paper.abstract: In the following years, the Fermilab Muon Campus will deliver highly polarized muon beams to the Muon g-2 Experiment. The Muon Campus contains a target section wherein secondaries are produced, the delivery ring which separates the muons from the rest of the beam and a sequence of beamlines that transports them to the Muon g-2 storage ring. Here, we report the first results of beam measurements at the Muon Campus with emphasis on the key achievements that have contributed to the successful beam delivery to the Muon g-2 Experiment. These achievements include the production of an intense secondary beam from the target, it's transport over 2 km, the successful monitoring of muons from the available diagnostics and the development of techniques for measuring the transverse optics. We also present detailed comparisons between experimental data and simulation and discuss the similarities and differences observed.

There are some problems in your paper which editor could not process successfully: 1. A wrong Fig. No.(Fig.10) is mentioned in the text. There are only 6 figures in text. 2. Ref.7 is not mentioned in the text. 3. In references list, "et al.,"should be write in the font "Italic". A period is need before the comma.
